text: Lazar Castle (, ), is a castle located in Lăzarea, Harghita County, Romania. The citadel is named after Lázár de Szárhegy noble family and it is built on a combination of Romanesque, Gothic and Renaissance styles. The oldest part of the building dates to 1532, while the rest was added in 1631–1632.
